item.title: Securely accessing AWS EC2 instances
item.description: Accessing EC2 instances in an AWS account is a cumbersome, repetitve process that can even compromise your security if done careless. Let’s say I wanted to launch a new instance right now. I would need to: Create an EC2 keypair and download it to the client machine Run a create-instance command Figure out the public hostname or IP address of the new instance Create or modify the rules of the attached security group to allow SSH traffic from my IP address Log into the instance These 4 steps might not seem like a very long process, but it can get repetitive and cumbersome if you’re constantly launching instances to test a deployment.
